meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>rice paddy</kanji> is used as a <kanji>substitute</kanji> for an <kanji>island</kanji>. Which island is it? That's right, <vocabulary>Tashirojima</vocabulary>. Imagine a rice paddy in the middle of the sea, standing in for <vocabulary>Tashiro Island</vocabulary>
readingMnemonic:
This is a place name and it uses the kun'yomi. You haven't learned this particular kun'yomi for 代 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember it:

When you go to <vocabulary>Tashirojima</vocabulary>, make sure you visit the old woman. You know what woman I'm talking about, the one who starred on Murder <reading>she wro</reading>te (しろ). She writes a lot about cats now, I guess.
